poem:
### Echoes of the New Order

A shift in the morning air  
as soldiers fill the civilian chairs.  
A dance of power, quiet yet bold,  
echoes of past regimes unfold.

Democracy's delicate tune,  
threaded with cautious noon,  
while shadows of history's stage,  
tread once more on the page.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Indonesia passes controversial law allowing greater military role in government Indonesia has ratified controversial changes to its military law allowing armed forces personnel to hold more civilian posts, a move that analysts fear could usher in a resurgence of the military in government affairs. Activists in the world’s third-largest democracy have criticised the revisions, warning they signal a return to Indonesia’s “New Order” era, when the country was led by former authoritarian ruler Suharto, who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
